intro: Epilobium × badense, commonly known as the hybrid willowherb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the genus Epilobium, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Onagraceae. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as wet meadows, riverbanks, and roadside areas. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
